main event: On January 7, 1948, a bright, flaming red cone trailing a gaseous green mist was observed in the sky southwest of Wilmington, Ohio, for approximately 35 minutes.
interesting points: The object gained and lost altitude at seemingly terrific bursts of speed., The observations were made by multiple control tower operators at Clinton County Air Base., The phenomenon could pierce through a heavy layer of clouds, obscuring other celestial phenomena., The object was described as much larger than a star, with a color change from red to amber-yellow., Witnesses noted that it hung suspended in the air at times and disappeared over the horizon at approximately 7:55 PM.
sighted object: a flaming red cone with a gaseous green mist
witnesses: Control Tower operators and HQ members of the alert crew
